text: in this video I'm going to very briefly
go through all 41 of Ableton Live 11's
audio effects if you have Ableton Live
10 most of the effects are the exact
same spare a few I'm gonna do this all
in under eight minutes if you like the
content make sure to subscribe let's go
beat repeat works by grabbing a small
section of your sound and repeating it
to give you a glitching effect
[Music]
delay Echo filter delay and grain delay
are all delay tools the main difference
is that Echo comes with extra settings
for modulation and Reverb
filter delay comes with three bands of
Equalization as well as being able to
change the parameters for the left and
the right separately or the left and
right signals together
[Music]
grain delay works by taking very small
pieces of your sound turning them into
what are called grains and then playing
the back through the delay to get some
really interesting sounds
[Music]
Looper is used by pressing the record
button recording something that you're
playing and then it will continuously
play in a loop after
time grabs slices of your audio and use
as a resonator within the plugin to make
some really interesting Patty type
sounds
[Music]
drive and color amp and cabinet are both
used to emulate old-school guitar amps
and speakers seven different presets
here of all the different styles of amp
and then we have the different speaker
sizes in cabinet to emulate different
size speakers and amps
[Music]
drum bus is a saturator limiter and bass
enhancer you can learn more about it in
this video up in the corner Dynamic tube
erosion overdrive saturator vial
Distortion and pedal are all saturation
or Distortion plugins erosion uses sine
waves and noise to implement extra
harmonics
[Music]
overdrive is a saturation with a filter
[Music]
paddle emulates an old-school guitar
distortion pedal
saturator is a wave shaper which means
it actually changes the waveform which
gives it a bit more Grit
it does make it louder so you can
actually turn down the output to
compensate for that extra volume what's
different about vinyl Distortion is that
it actually sounds like you're playing
an old vinyl record so adding just a
little bit of this makes it feel like an
old school analog type track
and last we have Redux which is a bit
Crusher that reduces the quality so that
it sounds more like an old school video
game
[Music]
Dynamics compressor glue compressor
multiband Dynamics are all very similar
the compressor is a traditional
compressor which is used to reduce
dynamic range of a sound to control the
overall volume make things punchier make
things less Punchy the glue compressor
is very similar to a regular compressor
except it's emulated after an old school
compressor which gives it just a little
bit of an analog warmth you can check
the description for a link to the video
which explains this further the
multiband Dynamics is a compressor that
works with three different bands you can
control the highs the mids and the lows
separately to have control over
different areas of your sounds A Noise
Gate is used to reduce the volume below
the threshold so this is great for
working with vocals or live recordings
where you want to reduce the volume of
the background noise or some breaths or
noises that you don't want in your
recording or your sound as I bring the
threshold up more and more of the sound
will be cut out
last we have the limiter which creates a
digital ceiling so that the signal
cannot pass through that amount right
here we have negative 0.3 so if I turn
up the gain the quieter signals will get
louder but the louder signals will stop
at negative 0.3 this is used mostly in
the mastering stages of a track EQ and
filters the way that equalizers work is
by reducing or amplifying parts of a
signal by pushing or pulling on
different nodes with starting with the
EQ we have three bands the lows the mids
and the highs we can push each section
of the track louder or quieter
eq3 is very similar how it has the
lowest mids and the highs but you can
actually control the frequencies for the
low and the highs which will in turn
control the mids my personal favorite is
eq8 which gives you a visual
representation
and gives you up to eight bands that you
can work with and Pull and push
according to however you'd like some
filter settings in here as well
Auto Filter Works by turning on a low
Pass High Pass band or allowing you to
move that up or down
this cuts out a lot of the frequency of
your sound similar to how you use an EQ
I won't touch on the modulators because
those are Macs for live devices let's
move on to the pitch and modulation
first we have the auto pan this is just
going to move the signal back and forth
between the left and the right sides of
the stereo image
[Music]
Ableton satin has the chorus but the
Ableton 11 is chorus and Ensemble which
essentially just pushes the width of the
sounds and slightly detunes them so that
it sounds like more than one sound is
playing at the same time
[Music]
phaser and flanger pushes in and out the
phase of the sound or adds flanger to it
which makes it sound very Spacey and
warped and kind of wish-washy
[Music]
thank you
last we have shifter or frequency
shifter this is going to change the
pitch or the fine tuning of your sound
[Music]
Reverb and resonance Corpus is a virtual
resonator that emulates percussive
sounds to give you complex resonances
foreign
[Music]
Reflections to give you a feeling of
space and atmosphere in your songs the
hybrid Reverb is a convolutionary verb
which means it uses algorithms to create
your Reverb I find hybrid Reverb is much
better for drums and the original Reverb
is much better for synths
spectral resonator creates harmonics by
pushing up the frequencies foreign
[Music]
ER brings one thing to mind for most
producers and that is the Daft Punk
sound
but it's also great for adding some
extra white noise to your sound
[Music]
resonator adds different notes by
pushing up these resonances
[Music]
utilities the audio effect rack is a way
to place in multiple effects which
allows you to use macros you can imagine
this as the effects are your tools and
this is your toolbox you can also route
different parameters to these macro
knobs so turning one knob will change
multiple parameters
external audio effect is for if you're
eroding in any external hardware you can
run it through here spectrum is a
spectrum analyzer which shows you in
higher quality than the EQ the actual
frequencies in a spectrum
[Music]
tuner shows you the pitch of the track
and how far off you are from the actual
proper note utility allows you to push
or reduce the amount of width as well as
the panning and the output gain
[Music]
